meanings.definition: The act of excessively protecting someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her overprotections sometimes make it hard for him to learn from his mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The overprotections of the parents were well-intentioned but stifling for the child.
meanings.sent3: The overprotections of the guard dog led to it barking at every passing shadow.
meanings.sent4: The overprotections of the software made it nearly impossible for any unauthorized access.
meanings.sent5: The overprotections of the umbrella kept her completely dry even in the heaviest rain.

meanings.definition: Excessive care or caution in protecting someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His overprotections extended to ensuring every corner of the house was childproof.
meanings.sent2: The overprotections of the museum staff ensured the artifacts remained pristine.
meanings.sent3: The overprotections of the chef resulted in a dish that was almost too carefully prepared.
meanings.sent4: The overprotections of the goalkeeper made it nearly impossible for any ball to get past.
meanings.sent5: The overprotections of the security system made the building feel like a fortress.
